parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes:
The name of the visit is typically preprinted on the CRF, and should match the name of the visit in the protocol. May be used to derive the SDTM variable VISITNUM. 
 Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit numbering or visit naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In these cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names, may need to be populated when the SDTM submission datasets are created.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the skin response measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the skin response measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Skin Response CRF using the date (SRDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if a skin response test as performed.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned skin response measurement, series of skin response measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Skin Response Test Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SRSTAT. If SRPERF="N", the value of SRSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SRPERF="Y", SRSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SRCAT and SRSCAT, SRTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD would be populated as SRALL and an appropriate test name (SRTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: SRPERF
fields.questionText: Was a skin response test performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why the test or examination was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When SRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable SRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Skin Response Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the test was not done?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the skin response category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Skin Response Category for Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the skin response?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the skin response subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the SRCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. SRSCAT can only be used if there is an SRCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SRCAT.
fields.label: Skin Response Subcategory for Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the skin response?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Skin Response Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: SRSPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Skin Response Object of the Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SROBJ

self.title: Skin Response Object of the Observation

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the antigen administered to the skin to elicit the skin response.
fields.definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by SRTEST.
fields.label: Skin Response Object of the Observation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SROBJ
fields.questionText: What intervention was performed to elicit the skin response?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Skin Response Date of Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRRFTDAT

self.title: SR Date of Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of the test material administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. If the date of administration is collected on a separate CRF (e.g., VISDAT), then it should not be collected on the SR CRF.
fields.label: SR Date of Reference Time Point
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: SRRFTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Skin Response Time of Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRRFTTIM

self.title: SR Time of Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of the test material administration using this format (hh:mm:ss).
fields.definition: The time of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis of the skin response (e.g., multiple [intervention] administrations.)
fields.label: SR Time of Reference Time Point
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: SRRFTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Skin Response Location used for Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of skin response test.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for skin response). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: SR Location Used for Measurement
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location where the test was performed.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C112023

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Skin Response Test or Examination Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRTEST

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name

self.title: Skin Response Test or Examination Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the skin response test if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. SRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in SRTEST. The SDTMIG variables SRTESTCD and SRTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: SRTEST
fields.questionText: What was the skin response test name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRTPT

self.title: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for skin response, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. Time point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) and SRRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.
fields.name: SRTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point for skin response measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the measurements, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT) and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Skin Response Observation Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: SRDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the skin response measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: The time of measurement (if required) can be determined from a collected time of the visit (VISTIM) and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Skin Response Observation Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: SRTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location where the test was performed.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SREVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SREVAL
fields.questionText: Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SREVALID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
fields.definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in SREVAL.
fields.implementationNotes: If EVALID needs to be collected for each test on the horizontal record the CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_ EVALID can be used.
fields.label: Skin Response Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SREVALID
fields.questionText: What was the identifier of the evaluator providing the skin response information?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Results or Findings in Original Units

self.title: SR Results or Findings in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record the skin response test result.
fields.definition: Result of the skin response test as originally received or collected.
fields.label: SR Results or Findings in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the unit of measure associated with the test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.
fields.label: SR Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRNRIND

fields.completionInstructions: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
fields.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
fields.implementationNotes: The category of the value within the respective reference range. Ranges may be defined by SRORNRLO and SRORNRHI or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
fields.label: Skin Response Reference Range Indicator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SRNRIND
fields.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SR.SRCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: If this level of information is needed, it may be added to the CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPSR dataset as the value of SUPPSR.QVAL where SUPPSR.QNAM ="SRCLSIG" and SUPPSR.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: SRCLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the result clinically significant?
